text: Mercury(I) fluoride, also known as mercurous fluoride, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is Hg2F2. It has mercury and fluoride ions in it. The mercury is in its +1 oxidation state. ==Properties== Mercury(I) fluoride is a light yellow solid. It evaporates at 240Â°C. It turns black when light is shined on it. It reacts with water to make mercury metal, mercury(II) oxide, and hydrofluoric acid. It is highly toxic. ==Preparation== It is made by reacting mercury(I) carbonate with hydrofluoric acid. ==Related pages== *Mercury(II) fluoride *Mercury(I) chloride Category:Mercury compounds Category:Fluorine compounds
title: Mercury(I) fluoride
